source_sentence: 「爾時，鵝王見彼天主牟修樓陀，作如是言：『今者善來。』
translation: "It was then that the king of geese saw that god Mucilinda and said, 'Now, you've come well.'

source_sentence: 種種語言問訊供養，既供養已，讚言：『善哉！
translation: He made offerings by greeting him with various words, and after making those offerings, he praised him, saying, 'Good!

source_sentence: 夜摩天王乃能如是不放逸行，甚為希有。
translation: It's rare that the Yama Heavenly King can thus conduct himself without dissipation.

source_sentence: 在此第一放逸之處，而能如是不行放逸，不放逸行，此為希有。
translation: Here, in the first place of dissipation, it's rare to be able to thus refrain from dissipation and not engage in careless behavior.

source_sentence: 復有希有：一切天主皆於天中百倍受樂，不行放逸，此甚希有；離樂因緣，則不可得。』
translation: It's also rare that all the lords of the gods experience a hundredfold pleasure in the heavens and don't behave carelessly; apart from the causes and conditions of pleasure, it's impossible to attain them.'

source_sentence: 「如是菩薩善時鵝王憶自本生，尸棄佛所曾聞經法。
translation: "Thus, the bodhisattva Good Times Goose King remembers that he was born in the past and that Śīkya Buddha had heard the sūtras and teachings.

source_sentence: 念彼經已，而為天主牟修樓陀如是說言：『汝大天王獲得善利，不放逸行，為聞我聲，是故來此，甚為希有。
translation: After he remembered that sūtra, he spoke thus for Mucilinda, the lord of the gods, saying, 'It's rare that you, the great god king, attained good benefits and didn't behave carelessly in order to hear my voice.

source_sentence: 汝今善聽，我為汝說。
translation: Now, listen well, and I will explain it for you.

source_sentence: 如彼世尊尸棄如來所說而說。
translation: I will explain it for you just as the Bhagavān Śikhin Tathāgata has explained it.

source_sentence: 當於爾時，我作人王，聞如來說，如本所聞，今為汝說。
translation: At the time, I was the king of men who heard the Tathāgata speak as I had heard him speak, and now I'll explain it for you.

source_sentence: 汝今諦聽，善思念之。
translation: Now, listen closely, and consider it well.

source_sentence: 有一法門，名王法行，如是法門則能利益灌頂受位剎利大王。
translation: There's a certain teaching called the king's practice of the Dharma, and such a teaching can benefit the great king Jalili, who's consecrated and elevated to the throne.

source_sentence: 王得此法，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，正護國土，能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: Attaining this teaching, the king will always be comfortable and productive in the present world, correctly protect his land, protect himself, be praised by good people, and be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, and he'll be the king of Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 「『灌頂受位剎利大王成就何業，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，正護世間，大富大力，能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王，有大神通、大富大力？
translation: "'What karma has the consecrated, enlightened, and great king Śāriputra accomplished that will always bring comfort and benefit in the present life, properly protect the world, be very wealthy and powerful, protect himself, be praised by good people, be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, and be the king of Yama in the heavenly realm, with great superknowledge and great wealth and power?'

source_sentence: 所謂此王具足成就三十七法，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，正護世間，護世間故，大富大力，一切餘王不能破壞，能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: This king is said to be fully accomplished in thirty-seven ways, to be eternally comfortable in the present life, to have constant benefit, to correctly protect the world, to protect the world because of that, to be so wealthy and powerful that all other kings can't destroy him, to be able to protect himself, to be praised by good people, to be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, and to be known as King Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 「『何等名為三十七法？
translation: "'What are the thirty-seven dharmas?'

source_sentence: 一者軍眾一切淨潔；二者依法賦稅受取；三者恒常懷忍不怒；四者平直斷事不偏；五者恒常供養尊長；六者順舊，依前而與；七者布施，心不慳悋；八者不攝非法行者；九者不近不善知識；十者貞謹，不屬婦女；第十一者聞諸語言不一切信；第十二者愛善名稱，不貪財物；第十三者捨離邪見；第十四者恒常惠施；第十五者愛語美說；第十六者如實語說；第十七者於諸臣眾若無因緣，不舉不下；第十八者知人好惡；第十九者常定一時，數見眾人；第二十者不多睡臥；二十一者常不懈怠；二十二者善友堅固；二十三者不近一切無益之友；二十四者瞋喜不動；二十五者不貪飲食；二十六者心善思惟；二十七者不待後時安詳而作；二十八者法利世間；二十九者恒常修行十善業道；第三十者信於因緣；三十一者常供養天；三十二者正護國土；三十三者正護妻子；三十四者常修習智；三十五者不樂境界；三十六者不令惡人住其國內；三十七者於一切民若祿、若位，依前法與。
translation: 一者軍眾一切淨潔；二者依法賦稅受取；三者恒常懷忍不怒；四者平直斷事不偏；五者恒常供養尊長；六者順舊，依前而與；七者布施，心不慳悋；八者不攝非法行者；九者不近不善知識；十者貞謹，不屬婦女；第十一者聞諸語言不一切信；第十二者愛善名稱，不貪財物；第十三者捨離邪見；第十四者恒常惠施；第十五者愛語美說；第十六者如實語說；第十七者於諸臣眾若無因緣，不舉不下；第十八者知人好惡；第十九者常定一時，數見眾人；第二十者不多睡臥；二十一者常不懈怠；二十二者善友堅固；二十三者不近一切無益之友；二十四者瞋喜不動；二十五者不貪飲食；二十六者心善思惟；二十七者不待後時安詳而作；二十八者法利世間；二十九者恒常修行十善業道；第三十者信於因緣；三十一者常供養天；三十二者正護國土；三十三者正護妻子；三十四者常修習智；三十五者不樂境界；三十六者不令惡人住其國內；三十七者於一切民若祿、若位，依前法與。

source_sentence: 是等名為三十七法。
translation: These are called the thirty-seven qualities.

source_sentence: 若成就此三十七法，得名受位剎利大王，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，大富大樂，有多財寶，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: If he accomplishes these thirty-seven things, he'll be called the great king of the bhadra who's been given a position, will always be comfortable and have constant benefit in the present world, become very wealthy and happy, have lots of wealth, be able to protect his land and protect himself, be praised by good people, and be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, and will be the king of the nightmares in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以如是等三十七法善業因故。
translation: It's because of these thirty-seven causes of good actions.

source_sentence: 「『何者名為剎利大王軍眾淨潔？
translation: "'What's called the army of the great king Śāriputra that purifies?'

source_sentence: 所謂善心利益他人。
translation: "It's called being well-intentioned and beneficial to others.

source_sentence: 於對諍者依法斷事，不違法律，依法正護，不違本要。
translation: It's stopping a dispute according to the law, not contradicting the law, and correctly defending it according to the law, not contradicting the fundamentals.

source_sentence: 忠心諫主，主行利益，順成讚善，依法護國。
translation: He faithfully remonstrates with his lord, conducts himself for his lord's benefit, conforms to praise and goodness, and protects his country according to the law.

source_sentence: 所設言教，依量利益，且起直心，不惱於他。
translation: The words and teachings they set forth are measured for benefit, and they arise with a straightforward mind that isn't tormented by others.

source_sentence: 依法事主，不唯畏罰。
translation: Serving the lord according to the Dharma, they aren't merely afraid of punishment.

source_sentence: 心無貪慢。
translation: He's free of craving and conceit in his mind.

source_sentence: 於一切法皆順不違，為未來世，隨法而行，怖畏生死，信業果報，捨三惡業，不樂多欲，不憙行罰，正意不亂。
translation: They conform to and don't disobey all things, conduct themselves according to the teaching for future generations, fear birth and death, believe in the results of actions, abandon the three bad actions, don't enjoy many desires, don't become jealous of actions and punishments, and don't confuse their right mind.

source_sentence: 如是自他二皆能度，能利益王。
translation: Thus, they can save both themselves and others, and they can benefit the king.

source_sentence: 若如是者，是王軍眾。
translation: If this is the case, then this is the king's army.

source_sentence: 如是軍眾與王相應，是故令王於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: Because this army is associated with the king, it will always bring the king comfort and benefit in the present world, protect the land and protect itself, be praised by good people, and be born on a good path when its body breaks up and its life ends, making it the king of Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以諸軍眾一切淨潔，是故令王不生惡心，善業因故。
translation: Because his armies are all clean, the king doesn't become evil-minded, which is the result of good actions.

source_sentence: 「『又復受位剎利大王，次第二法應勤修習，成就相應，於現在世常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: "'Furthermore, he'll be elevated to the position of great king Śāriputra, who will diligently cultivate the second teaching, achieving its concomitant benefits in the present life, protecting his land and protecting himself, praised by good people, and born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, and who'll be the king of Yama in the heavenly realm.'

source_sentence: 何者第二？
translation: What's the second?

source_sentence: 所謂依法賦稅受取，以供衣食。
translation: It's called taxing and accepting according to the law to provide food and clothing.

source_sentence: 云何依法？
translation: What is according to the law?

source_sentence: 或國或城、或村或邑、或人集處，於一切時常依舊則、依道理取。
translation: Whether it's a country or a city, a village or a town, or a place where people gather, they always take according to the old rules and according to reason at all times.

source_sentence: 彼王如是，若國壞時、若天儉時則不賦稅，取時以理，不逼不罰，依先舊來常所用稱斗尺均平。
translation: Thus, the king doesn't tax the country when it breaks down or when it's frugal, takes it according to reason when it's taken, doesn't force or punish it, and follows the old ways of the past in weighing the pintle and the foot equally.

source_sentence: 如是受取，依法不違，不逼不罰，不侵不奪，如是國王則是憐愍一切眾生。
translation: Thus accepting and taking according to the law without transgression, without constraining or punishing, and without encroaching or taking away, the king thus shows compassion for all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 王若如是依法受取，功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: If the king thus takes it according to the law, the merits and causes of that merit will always bring comfort and benefit in the present life, protect the land and protect himself, be praised by good people, and be born in a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, as King Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以常依法賦稅受取善業因故。
translation: That's because he's always taxed according to the law and receives the results of good actions.

source_sentence: 「『又復受位剎利大王有第三法應勤修習，成就相應，不逼國土，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, there's a third thing that you should diligently cultivate to achieve the rank of Śāriputra, which is associated with not pushing the land and will benefit both the present and future.

source_sentence: 何者第三？
translation: What's the third?

source_sentence: 所謂恒常懷忍不怒。
translation: "It's called always holding back anger.

source_sentence: 心如是念：「隨何因緣令我瞋忿，如是因緣一切皆捨。」
translation: The mind thus thinks, "Whatever cause causes me to be angry, such causes and conditions will all be abandoned."

source_sentence: 身雖自在，見他瑕疵，不譏不調。
translation: Although his body is at ease, he sees the imperfections of others and doesn't criticize or tame them.

source_sentence: 於諸臣僚、眷屬、僕使有罪過者，不重刑罰。
translation: He doesn't severely punish ministers, their retinues, or their servants for their faults.

source_sentence: 於他怨人，若他親善，不說其過、不說其惡。
translation: He doesn't speak of the faults of others who resent him or of their goodness, and he doesn't speak of their evil.

source_sentence: 若於軍眾起瞋心時，則念忍辱；念忍辱故，瞋心則滅。
translation: When he becomes angry with an army, he'll be mindful of patience; because he's mindful of patience, his anger will cease.

source_sentence: 口說美語，更說異言，令彼軍眾不憂不怖。
translation: He speaks well, and he also speaks differently, so that the troops aren't sad or frightened.

source_sentence: 恒常如是一切法中一切時忍，自體實忍，非因緣故，如是不瞋，如是不忿。
translation: He constantly thus tolerates all things at all times, tolerates his own essence as it really is, and doesn't anger or resent it because it's not a cause or condition.

source_sentence: 王若如是心懷忍辱，功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: If the king thus bears patience in mind, the merits and causes of that patience will always bring comfort and benefit in the present world, protect the land and protect himself, be praised by good people, and be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, making him King Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以能於人恒常懷忍善業因故。
translation: That's because he's able to always bear with people as a result of good actions.

source_sentence: 「『又復受位剎利大王有第四法應勤修習，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, there's a fourth thing that you should diligently cultivate to achieve concomitant benefits in the present and two future lives, according to the great king Śāriputra, who's also been given the rank of Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 何者第四？
translation: What's the fourth?

source_sentence: 所謂平直斷事不偏。
translation: "It's called being even-handed and not biased when cutting things off.

source_sentence: 王善心意，於一切民猶如父母，不以物故、不以用故、不以親故、不以恩故、不以友故、不以貴勢有囑及故，不用如是一切因緣，依法斷事，不偏不黨。
translation: The king has a good mind, for which all people are like parents, not because of things, not because of use, not because of relatives, not because of kindness, not because of friends, and not because of wills from noble and powerful people, and he doesn't use all these causes and conditions to decide matters according to the Dharma without favoritism or partiality.

source_sentence: 於諍對者怨親平等，利益語說，實語而說。
translation: He explains the equality of enemies and intimates, speaks beneficially, and explains it in truth.

source_sentence: 王若如是平直斷事，功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，不失國土、不失名稱，一切軍眾皆無罪罰，能護國土，不畏他論，他王不勝，久時為王，王領國土，能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: If the king thus ends matters even-handedly and with meritorious causes and conditions, he'll always attain well-being and constant benefit in the present world, never lose his land or name, have all his troops go unpunished, protect his land, defy other kings' arguments, be invincible to other kings, become king for a long time, lead his kingdom, protect himself, be praised by good people, and be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, and become King Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以心平直斷事不偏善業因故。
translation: That's because his mind is level and straight, and he ends things without biased causes of good actions.

source_sentence: 「『又復受位剎利大王有第五法應勤修習，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益，如是乃至到於涅槃。
translation: "'Furthermore, there's a fifth thing that the great king Zāri should diligently cultivate to achieve concomitant benefits in the present and two future lives, such that he'll reach nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 何者第五？
translation: What's the fifth?

source_sentence: 所謂恒常供養尊長。
translation: "It's called always making offerings to venerable people.

source_sentence: 何者尊長？
translation: What's a venerable?

source_sentence: 謂尊長者，如實而見，持戒智行利益眾生，常作善業，身口意等恒常寂靜，自心無垢令他攝福。
translation: That's a venerable person who sees things as they really are, observes precepts, conducts wisely, benefits sentient beings, always does good work, is always still in body, speech, and mind, and causes others to gather merit from the spotlessness of his own mind.

source_sentence: 如是尊長，王應親近。
translation: Such a venerable person is someone the king should get close to.

source_sentence: 既親近已，聽法聞法，常往供養，受其所說，受其言教。
translation: Once he has become intimate, he'll listen to the teaching and hear it, always go to make offerings, accept what he teaches, and accept his words and teachings.

source_sentence: 如其所說，王應受持，如所說行。
translation: According to what he teaches, the king should accept it and conduct himself according to what's taught.

source_sentence: 以一切時供養尊長功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: Because of the merits of making offerings to that venerable at all times, he'll always attain well-being and constant benefit in the present world, protect his land and protect himself, be praised by good people, and be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, becoming the king of Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以一切時供養尊長善業因緣。
translation: He makes offerings to venerable elders at all times based on the causes and conditions of good actions.

source_sentence: 「『又復受位剎利大王有第六法應勤修習，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, there's a sixth thing that you should diligently cultivate to achieve concomitant benefits in the present and two future lives, according to the great king Śāriputra, who's also been given the rank of Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 何者第六？
translation: What's the sixth?

source_sentence: 所謂順舊，依前而與。
translation: "It's called giving according to the old, depending on the former.

source_sentence: 若父先與、若祖先與，或復先祖於先舊與，若地、若金、若銀等物，彼受位王以不濁心、以清淨心隨順歡喜，愛樂彼法。
translation: If his father gave it to him first, or if his grandfather gave it to him first, or if another grandfather gave it to him in the past, or if it were something like earth, gold, or silver, the king who's accepted the position will rejoice and be pleased with that teaching with an unsullied mind and a pure heart.

source_sentence: 如是依舊，隨順讚善，教他令與。
translation: Thus, he relies on the past, complies, praises it well, and teaches others to give it to him.

source_sentence: 王若如是依前而與，功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: If the king thus relies on the previous giving, the merits of which will always bring comfort and benefit in the present life, protect the land and protect himself, and be praised by good people, he'll be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, and he'll be the king of Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以常順舊依前而與善業因故。
translation: That's because he always follows his predecessors and gives them the cause of good actions.

source_sentence: 「『又復受位剎利大王有第七法應勤修習，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, there's a seventh thing that the great king Zali should diligently cultivate to achieve concomitant benefits in the present and two future lives.

source_sentence: 何者第七？
translation: What's the seventh?

source_sentence: 所謂布施，心不慳悋。
translation: It's called giving generosity, which is not stingy in mind.

source_sentence: 何者布施？
translation: What's generosity?

source_sentence: 布施者名少、壯、老時恒常布施，布施一切，一切種施、一切時施，利益一切、饒益一切、安樂一切，常念地獄、餓鬼、畜生一切道中受飢渴等種種苦惱。
translation: "Someone who gives generously is called someone who always gives generously when they're young, strong, and old, gives generously to all things, gives generously of all kinds, gives generously at all times, benefits all things, benefits all things, and pleases all things, and is always mindful of the various sufferings and distress of hunger and thirst in all the destinies of hell, hungry ghosts, and animals.

source_sentence: 布施之時，願如是等三趣眾生早得解脫，生人天中。
translation: When he gives alms, may sentient beings in these three destinies be liberated early and be born among the gods.

source_sentence: 王若如是，得現世報。
translation: If the king thus does, he'll attain worldly rewards in the present.

source_sentence: 何者現報？
translation: What's the present reward?

source_sentence: 所謂名稱；若遭難時，奴僕軍眾則不捨離；他國土人常來供養，餘人見已，不能破壞，一切怨敵乃至不能得其少便，於他常勝。
translation: They are called 'names,' and when they're in trouble, their slaves and soldiers don't abandon them; people from other lands always come to offer support, and when others see them, they can't harm them; all their enemies can't even get the slightest advantage over them; and they're always superior to others.

source_sentence: 如是布施，得現世報。
translation: Such almsgiving will bring worldly rewards in the present.

source_sentence: 非福田處如是布施，尚得如是現世果報，況於福田物思具足勝善布施，常閉惡道，常受樂報，彼無量種布施而與。
translation: Such generosity in places that aren't fields of merit still yields such present rewards, so why wouldn't someone in a field of merit who considers it to be a perfectly good gift that always prevents bad states and always brings pleasant rewards, which are countless in number and can be given as alms?

source_sentence: 何者無量？
translation: What's countless?

source_sentence: 謂法布施，資生布施，無畏布施。
translation: They are almsgiving to the Dharma, almsgiving to those who support life, and almsgiving without fear.

source_sentence: 王如是等種種布施，若施沙門、施婆羅門，如是布施功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: If the king thus makes these kinds of gifts, if he gives to ascetics or priests, the meritorious causes and conditions of such gifts will always bring comfort and benefit in the present life, protect the land and protect himself, be praised by good people, and be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, making him the king of the gods and the world, the king of the night.

source_sentence: 以彼布施善業因故。
translation: That's because of the causes of their good actions of generosity.

source_sentence: 「『又復受位剎利大王有第八法應勤捨離，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, the eighth thing that the great king Śāriputra should diligently abandon in order to achieve concomitant benefits in the present and two future lives.

source_sentence: 何者第八？
translation: What's the eighth?

source_sentence: 所謂不攝非法行者，不令在國。
translation: It's called not accepting someone who's doing something unlawful and not allowing them to stay in the country.

source_sentence: 以剎利王自隨法行，是故不攝非法行者，不令住國。
translation: Because King Kali himself practices according to the Dharma, he doesn't take in people who aren't practicing what's right and doesn't allow them to stay in his country.

source_sentence: 何者名為非法行者？
translation: What's called an unlawful practitioner?

source_sentence: 所謂有人種種方便劫奪他物，或扠他咽令其悶絕，而取其物。
translation: It means a person variously steals another person's property, or they may forfeit their throat and cause them to become dull, and then they take their property.

source_sentence: 或與惡藥，令無覺知而取其物。
translation: They may give bad medicine, making them numb, and then take their things.

source_sentence: 或設方便，盜偷他物。
translation: Sometimes they devise a way to steal another person's property.

source_sentence: 或復私竊盜取他物。
translation: They may steal another person's property by stealing it privately.

source_sentence: 或在道路或在市中，作諸方便而取他物。
translation: They may make various means on the road or in the marketplace to take another's property.

source_sentence: 買真賣偽，種種欺誑而取他物。
translation: They buy what's real, sell what's counterfeit, and deceive others in various ways to obtain their goods.

source_sentence: 或復有人姦欺無道，壓善舉惡，進非退是，誣抂賢良，黨助不肖。
translation: Another person cheats and deceives the immoral, suppresses good and raises evil, advances what's wrong and retreats from what's right, misrepresents the good, and assists the unscrupulous.

source_sentence: 或有邪見、或有斷見。
translation: Sometimes they have wrong views, or they may have views that are cut off.

source_sentence: 或復有人苦殺眾生，望得解脫。
translation: Another person kills sentient beings in pain in hopes of gaining liberation.

source_sentence: 若外道齋，於大會中屠殺羊等，望有福德。
translation: If a non-Buddhist observes the precepts and slaughters sheep and so forth in a large assembly, expecting to have merit, then he'll be saved.

source_sentence: 或復有人犍割眾生，令使不男。
translation: Another person may gandharva slaughter sentient beings to make them impotent.

source_sentence: 或復有人婬於男子。
translation: Another person may have lusted after a man.

source_sentence: 或復有人不能供養父母師長。
translation: Another person doesn't support their parents, teachers, and elders.

source_sentence: 如是等人，不令住國。
translation: Such a person won't be allowed to live in the country.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 若共同國，令諸善人心意壞故，相倣習故。
translation: "If they share the same country, it causes the minds of good people to deteriorate and their tendencies to associate with each other to deteriorate.

source_sentence: 同處住故，善人壞故，令王無力，失增上力。
translation: Because they live together, the good people are destroyed, which causes the king to lack power and lose his superior strength.

source_sentence: 非時降雨，時則不雨；五穀熟時，五穀不熟。
translation: When it's not the right time to send rain, it doesn't rain, and when the five grains are ripe, they don't ripen.

source_sentence: 所有國土一切破壞，惡人過故。
translation: All lands are destroyed, and it's because of the faults of bad people.

source_sentence: 以此因緣，不令惡人住在國內。
translation: Because of this cause, they won't allow evil people to live in their country.

source_sentence: 此因緣故，不攝一切非法行者，不令住國；依法行者，攝令在國。
translation: For this reason, they won't allow anyone who does anything unlawful to live in the country, and they'll allow someone who does it according to the law to stay in the country.

source_sentence: 攝法人故，隨時降雨，日觸順時，是故五穀至時善熟，不壞國土，離於怖畏，不生憂愁。
translation: Because they are included, rain falls at appropriate times and the sun meets the seasons, so the grains ripen well in time, the land isn't destroyed, they're free from fear, and sorrow doesn't arise.

source_sentence: 一切國土利益之事，是攝法人因緣力故，能斷一切生死苦惱，令有福人在己國住。
translation: These benefits for all lands are the result of the gathering person's causal power, which stops all suffering of birth and death and causes people of merit to stay in their country.

source_sentence: 以近如是福德人故、行法人故。
translation: It's because they're near such a person of merit and because they're practicing a legal practice.

source_sentence: 第一梵行，所謂安住。
translation: This is the first religious practice, which is called stabilizing.

source_sentence: 有福德人近福德人、順法行人，是故一切有智慧王近行法人，令住國內。
translation: Because a man of virtue approaches a man of virtue and a practitioner of the Dharma, the king of all men of wisdom approaches a practitioner of the Dharma and causes him to stay in his country.

source_sentence: 王若如是不攝一切非法行者，功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: If the king thus doesn't embrace all unlawful behavior, the merits and causes of that merit will always bring comfort and benefit in the present life, protect the land and protect himself, be praised by good people, and be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, making him King Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以彼不攝非法行者善業因故。
translation: That's because they don't embrace the causes of good actions by people who don't practice what's right.

source_sentence: 「『又復受位剎利大王有第九法應勤捨離，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, there's a ninth thing that the great king Zāri should diligently abandon in order to achieve concomitant benefits in the present and two future lives.

source_sentence: 何者第九？
translation: What's the ninth?

source_sentence: 所謂不近不善知識。
translation: "It's called not approaching an unskillful friend.

source_sentence: 不善知識是惡知識，彼惡知識略有八種，一切王者皆應捨離。
translation: An unwholesome friend is a bad friend, and there are slightly more than eight kinds of bad friends that all kings should avoid.

source_sentence: 何等為八？
translation: What are the eight?

source_sentence: 一者斷見，所謂有人如是心言：「無業，無施，無有此世，無有他世。」
translation: One is the view of elimination, which is called the mind of a person who says, "There's no action, there's no generosity, there's no present world, and there's no other world."

source_sentence: 此是最初惡知識也。
translation: This is the first bad friend.

source_sentence: 又復第二惡知識者，所謂有人如是心言：「一切婦女依時共行，不破梵行。」
translation: Also, the second bad friend is someone who says this to their mind, "All women who practice together at the right time don't refute the religious practice."

source_sentence: 又復第三惡知識者，所謂有人如是心言：「若以火燒，得大福德。
translation: Furthermore, the third bad friend is someone who is said to have this mind, "If you burn them with fire, you'll attain great merit.

source_sentence: 若與眾生，則無福德。」
translation: If I were to give it to sentient beings, there'd be no merit."

source_sentence: 又復第四惡知識者，所謂有人如是心言：「乃至未死，有命以來，得名為人。
translation: Furthermore, the fourth bad friend is someone who refers to this person's mind, saying, "Even before death and since life began, they've been called a human being.

source_sentence: 若身死已，善不善業一切皆失，如風吹雲，更無可集，眾生如是無有罪福。」
translation: If, after his or her death, all good and bad actions are lost, like a cloud blown by the wind, there's nothing left to gather, and sentient beings thus have no merit that's worthwhile."

source_sentence: 又復第五惡知識者，所謂有人常教他人破壞父母，亦復不聽供養尊長。
translation: The fifth bad friend is someone who always teaches others to destroy their parents and doesn't listen to support for their elders.

source_sentence: 又復第六惡知識者，所謂有人言殺生善；若殺老人、若殺盲人、惡病之人、長病人等，奪其命故，得生樂處。
translation: The sixth bad friend is someone who says it's good to kill people; if they kill an elderly person, a blind person, a person with a serious illness, or a long-term patient, they'll be born in a happy place after taking their life.

source_sentence: 又復第七惡知識者，所謂有人如是心言：「於山崖上自投身下，若火燒身、若自餓死，或五處火以炙其身，如是取死，有無量福，後得天上，無量眷屬、無量天女之所供養。」
translation: Again, the seventh bad friend is someone who says this to their heart, "If they plunge themselves off a cliff, if fire burns their body, if they die of starvation, or if fire burns their body in five places, and if they thus obtain death, they'll have measureless merit and will later attain heaven and be supported by measureless retinues and measureless goddesses."

source_sentence: 又復第八惡知識者，所謂有人如是心言：「一切由天，非業果報。」
translation: Furthermore, the eighth bad friend is someone who says, in their mind, "Everything comes from heaven, not from the results of actions."

source_sentence: 如是八種惡知識者，一切不聽住在國內，眼亦不看。
translation: Such a person with these eight bad qualities doesn't listen to anything, doesn't abide in their country, and doesn't look at anything with their eyes.

source_sentence: 唯攝一切實語說人，從如是人聽聞正法，聞已攝取，受持修行。
translation: He only collects all true speakers, hears the right teaching from such a person, collects it after hearing it, and maintains and cultivates it.

source_sentence: 王若如是不近一切不善知識，功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: If the king thus doesn't approach all unskillful people, the merits and causes of those merits will always bring comfort and benefit in the present life, protect the land and protect himself, be praised by good people, and be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, and he'll be the king of the gods and worlds as king Yama.

source_sentence: 以彼不近不善知識善業因故。
translation: That's because he doesn't approach unskillful people as a cause of good actions.

source_sentence: 「『又復受位剎利大王有第十法應勤捨離，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, the tenth thing that the great king Zāri should diligently abandon in order to achieve concomitant benefits in the present and two future lives is that he's also been elevated to the position of king of the bhadra.

source_sentence: 何者第十所謂有法應當捨離？
translation: What's the tenth thing that's supposed to exist that should be abandoned?

source_sentence: 捨何者法？
translation: What is the dharma of indifference?

source_sentence: 所謂婦女。
translation: "There's what's called a woman.

source_sentence: 有智之人不屬婦女，一切世間屬婦女者，於世間中最為凡鄙。
translation: Wise people don't belong to women, and those who belong to women in all the world are the most vulgar of the world.

source_sentence: 若餘凡人屬婦女者，猶尚凡鄙，豈況國王人中第一。
translation: If other ordinary people belong to women, they're still ordinary and mean, so why wouldn't a king be the best among people?

source_sentence: 一切婦女能破壞人，一切國土、一切人民、一切王者皆由婦女而致破壞。
translation: All women can destroy people, and all lands, all people, and all kings are destroyed by women.

source_sentence: 以貪心故，能令王等皆失利益，能奪其物，令行非法，不聽布施。
translation: Because of their greed, they can cause kings and others to lose their benefits, seize their goods, make them act unlawfully, and disregard almsgiving.

source_sentence: 以貪心故，能令王等一切懈怠。
translation: Because of their greed, they can cause kings and others to be lazy.

source_sentence: 以樂欲故，常近不離，能令丈夫失自利益。
translation: Because of their desire, they're always near and don't part from it, which can cause a husband to lose his own benefits.

source_sentence: 婦女如雹，能害善苗。
translation: Women are like hailstones, which can harm good seedlings.

source_sentence: 一切婦女樂破壞語，慢妬之藏。
translation: All women enjoy destructive speech and the store of jealousy and pride.

source_sentence: 屬婦女人，行同婦女。
translation: When a woman belongs to a woman, her behavior is the same as that of a woman.

source_sentence: 屬婦女人，國土亦失。
translation: When a woman belongs to a woman, her land is also lost.

source_sentence: 是故不應繫屬婦女，若屬婦女則為凡鄙，以婦女法是鄙惡故。
translation: Therefore, you shouldn't be tied to women; if you belong to a woman, you're an ordinary despicable person, because the ways of women are despicable and bad.

source_sentence: 屬婦女人，亦為鄙惡。
translation: A woman who belongs to a woman is also despicable.

source_sentence: 屬婦女者，失一切法。
translation: Belonging to a woman will cause them to lose all their dharmas.

source_sentence: 屬婦女者，常入苦處。
translation: Belonging to a woman, they'll always enter a place of suffering.

source_sentence: 若屬婦女，善人捨離。
translation: If they belong to a woman, a good person will abandon them.

source_sentence: 以欲過故，如是之人，婦女所誑。
translation: Because of their desires and faults, such a person is deceived by women.

source_sentence: 一切婦女皆悉欺陵軟弱之人，體性爾故，不知恩養，能與衰惱，多貪妬嫉。
translation: All women are deceptive and weak, and because of their nature, they don't know kindness, are capable of bringing misfortune, and are often greedy and jealous.

source_sentence: 婦女如是，皆不可信。
translation: Such are women, and none of them can be trusted.

source_sentence: 若屬婦女，彼人則於城邑聚落一切人中最為凡鄙，何況王者，其損更深，是故不應繫屬婦女。
translation: If they were bound to a woman, she'd be the most despicable of all the people in the town or village, let alone a king, and that would be even more damaging; therefore, she shouldn't be bound to a woman.

source_sentence: 王若如是畏婦女過，功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: If the king thus fears the faults of women, the merits and causes of those faults will always bring comfort and benefit in the present life, protect the land and protect himself, be praised by good people, and be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, as King Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以離婦女善業因故。
translation: That's because it's the cause of good actions by women who part with them.

source_sentence: 「『又，剎利王復有一法是第十一，應勤修習，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, there's another teaching, the eleventh, that King Zali should diligently cultivate and achieve commensurate with it, for the benefit of the present and future generations.

source_sentence: 第十一者，謂聞言語不一切信。
translation: The eleventh is hearing words and not believing everything they say.

source_sentence: 一切世間人心不同，迭相破壞，性憙破壞。
translation: The minds of all the world's people are different, repeatedly destroyed, and their natures jealously damaged.

source_sentence: 作時能壞，成時能壞。
translation: They can be destroyed when they act, and they can be destroyed when they are formed.

source_sentence: 本性自體垢故破壞，常樂諍鬪故相破壞。
translation: They are destroyed because their intrinsic nature is inherently defiled, and they are destroyed because they are always happy to fight.

source_sentence: 以近親故，共相破壞。
translation: Because they're close to each other, they mutually destroy each other.

source_sentence: 自體破壞，以國土過，是故破壞。
translation: Their own bodies are destroyed, and because their land is wrong, they are destroyed.

source_sentence: 自輕因緣，故相破壞。
translation: Because of their own minor causes, they mutually destroy each other.

source_sentence: 彼此迭互闇地相說，各為自明，故相破壞。
translation: They repeatedly speak of each other in a dark place, each for its own knowledge, and so they destroy each other.

source_sentence: 欲令自勝，令他不如，故相破壞。
translation: They want to make themselves superior and make others inferior, so they mutually destroy each other.

source_sentence: 如是等語，王皆不信，違道理故，前後相違。
translation: The king didn't believe such words, and they contradicted the reason before and after.

source_sentence: 以從惡心次第來故，以愛自朋如是說故。
translation: It's because they come in order from a bad mind and because they love their own friends who say this.

source_sentence: 先被教來，於先囑來、先有恩來、先有怨來，迭相破壞，來向王說。
translation: After first being taught, the king was repeatedly contradicted by previous commands, previous kindnesses, and previous enmities.

source_sentence: 此如是等，前說因緣，迭相瞋故，作如是說。
translation: These and so forth were the causes and conditions explained earlier, and they repeatedly became angry with each other, so they made this kind of statement.

source_sentence: 王不普信，是以國土則不破壞。
translation: If the king doesn't believe in them universally, then the land won't be destroyed.

source_sentence: 如是王者，心性本好，不違不亂，依道理瞋，心不橫瞋，於破壞語，心不生信。
translation: Thus, the king's mind is inherently good, not contradictory or confused, and his mind doesn't become violently angry based on reasoned anger, and his mind doesn't give rise to faith when he speaks destructively.

source_sentence: 彼王自有如是功德，不信於他，自心所樂，少於瞋恚，一切眾生於王愛樂，心善思量，隨順法行，心意正直，多攝州土。
translation: The king has such virtues, doesn't believe in others, takes pleasure in his own mind, has little anger, and all sentient beings are delighted by the king, whose mind well deliberates, practices according to the teaching, and has a right mind that often includes the state's land.

source_sentence: 王若如是不一切信，功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: If the king thus doesn't have all faith, the merits and causes of that faith will always bring comfort and benefit in the present life, protect his land and protect himself, be praised by good people, and be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, making him King Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以不普信善業因故。
translation: That's because he doesn't have universal faith in the causes of good actions.

source_sentence: 「『又，剎利王復有一法是第十二，應勤修習，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, there's another teaching, the twelfth, that King Zali should diligently cultivate and achieve commensurate with it for the benefit of the present and future generations.

source_sentence: 第十二者，謂愛善名，不貪財物。
translation: The twelfth is loving good repute and not craving possessions.

source_sentence: 以王之心不貪財物，不急拳手、不動眉面、不怒眼目、不惡語說，其心終不無因緣瞋，又心亦不無因緣喜，心意堅固。
translation: Because the king's mind doesn't crave possessions, he doesn't make hasty fists or move his eyebrows or eyes, and doesn't speak harshly, and his mind is never without cause to be angry, and his mind isn't without cause to be joyous and resolute.

source_sentence: 王若如是得善名稱，亦得財物。
translation: If the king thus attains a good reputation, he'll also attain possessions.

source_sentence: 如是得已，於財物中不大歡喜。
translation: After thus attaining them, he's not overjoyed among the possessions.

source_sentence: 得名稱故，勝歡喜心，王法不妨，一切人愛怨不得便。
translation: Because he's been given a name, he's overjoyed, and the king's teaching isn't helpful, so all people who love and resent him won't be able to get an advantage over him.

source_sentence: 財物多故。
translation: That's because they have a lot of possessions.

source_sentence: 又復更有十種因緣得美名稱，何等為十？
translation: There are another ten kinds of causes and conditions for attaining a good reputation, and what are the ten?

source_sentence: 一者美語；二者能捨；三者審諦、四者他國遠人來看；五者近之則得安樂；六者以時給施左右；七者敬尊奉施所須，供給善人，拯濟孤獨；八者淨行；九者好心，不惱亂他；十者正見，不生邪見。
translation: One is a good speaker; two is capable of equanimity; three is discriminating; four is visited by people from far away in other countries; five is comfortable when they come near; six gives alms to left and right at the right time; seven honors and serves what's needed, makes offerings to good people, and saves the lonely; eight is pure in practice; nine is good-hearted and doesn't disturb others; and ten is right view that doesn't give rise to wrong views.

source_sentence: 得此十法，行如是法，復教他人行如是法。
translation: Attaining these ten qualities, he practices them and teaches others to practice them.

source_sentence: 以如是行得此法故，得善名稱。
translation: Because they thus practice these things, they attain a good name.

source_sentence: 王若如是愛善名稱，不貪財物，功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，隨順法行，他不能勝，異人近之則得安樂。
translation: If the king thus loves good names, doesn't crave possessions, and has meritorious causes and conditions, he'll always be comfortable and productive in the present world, always acting in accord with the Dharma in a way that others can't overcome, and others will be comfortable when they approach him.

source_sentence: 彼人久時作人中王，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: Long ago, that person became a king among men who could protect the land and himself, was praised by good people, and was born on a good path when his body broke up and his life ended, becoming the king of the nightmares in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以愛善名不貪財物善業因故。
translation: That's because he loves good words and doesn't crave possessions as a cause of good actions.

source_sentence: 「『又，剎利王復有一法是第十三，應勤捨離，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, there's another thing that King Zāri does, which is the thirteenth, that should be diligently abandoned and made compatible for the benefit of the present and future generations.

source_sentence: 第十三者，謂捨邪見。
translation: The thirteenth is renouncing wrong views.

source_sentence: 邪見者名一切眾生不安隱本。
translation: That mistaken view is called the root of all sentient beings' unease and uncertainty.

source_sentence: 此顛倒見，一切因緣皆不生信。
translation: With this mistaken view, faith doesn't arise from all causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 彼不信處，一切憎惡，一切毀訾，王則應捨。
translation: Where there's disbelief, everything they hate and everything they disparage, the king should abandon it.

source_sentence: 若王不捨，則邪見行，一切人憎，一切不信，一切諸人皆不順行。
translation: If the king doesn't abandon it, then the practice of wrong views will be detested by all people, disbelieved by all people, and practiced disobediently by all people.

source_sentence: 不順行故，一切人捨，得衰惱時，依法行天一切捨離；天捨去已，無所能為。
translation: When they act disobediently, all people abandon, and when they attain disillusionment, the gods abandon everything according to the practices of the Dharma; after they abandon them, there's nothing they can do.

source_sentence: 是故王者應捨邪見，王若如是正見不邪，功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，於一切時作正利益，為一切人之所供養，一切人愛，依法行天常不捨離，一切國人如王意行，一切分別、一切心念皆悉具得。
translation: Therefore, the king should abandon wrong views; if he thus rightly views and doesn't act wrongly, the merits and causes of that right view will always bring comfort and benefit in the present life, protect the land and protect himself, be praised by good people, produce right benefits at all times, be an offering to all people, be loved by all people, always conduct himself according to the gods, and have all the people of his country conduct themselves according to the king's wishes, and have all discernment and all mindfulness of mind.

source_sentence: 彼王心意本性不亂，能於久時王領國土，安隱無患，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: The king's mind is not disturbed by nature, so he can lead his kingdom for a long time, be secure and without danger, and when his body breaks up and his life ends, he'll be born on a good path and become King Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以捨邪見善業因故。
translation: That's because he's abandoned the causes of good actions in mistaken views.

source_sentence: 「『又，剎利王復有一法是第十四，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, there's another teaching of King Zali's that's the fourteenth, which accomplishes concomitant benefits in the present and two future lives.

source_sentence: 第十四者，謂世間法、出世間法、王根本法，所謂惠施。
translation: The fourteenth is a worldly Dharma, an extra-mundane Dharma, or a fundamental Dharma of the king, which is called giving generosity.

source_sentence: 王若大臣能行惠施，一切國人敬愛不捨，心生敬重，不捨其國向餘國土。
translation: If the king's ministers are able to practice generosity, the people of all the countries will love them and not abandon them, and they'll become respectful and won't abandon their countries and go to other lands.

source_sentence: 若餘國人，以王能施，共自妻子并其軍眾，一切皆來歸屬於王。
translation: If the people of those other lands respond to the king's generosity, their wives and armies will all come to the king.

source_sentence: 多人來故，令王國人增長更多，自餘諸國不能破壞。
translation: Because so many people come, the kingdom's people will grow even larger, and the other countries themselves won't be able to destroy them.

source_sentence: 以人多故，無能破壞。
translation: Because there are so many people, they aren't able to destroy it.

source_sentence: 如是施者，世間布施，於世間中第一安隱。
translation: Such giving is worldly giving, which is the most peaceful of the world.

source_sentence: 又復更有出世間施第一好施，若人布施，為天所攝，有大力能，有大威德。
translation: It's also the best gift that's given beyond the world, and if a person gives alms, it's taken in by the gods, has great power, and has great authority.

source_sentence: 布施沙門、若婆羅門、貧窮等人，莊嚴未來，現在好色。
translation: An ascetic, a brāhmaṇa, or a poor person who gives generosity adorns the future and has good looks in the present.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 心清淨故，食則清淨；食清淨故，面色清淨；面色淨故，端正可憙。
translation: When the mind is purified, food is purified, food is purified, the countenance is purified, and the countenance is purified, making it upright and jolly.

source_sentence: 此等皆是布施之力，又復有法，現得果報。
translation: These are all the powers of generosity, and there's another way to get their results in the present.

source_sentence: 何者現報？
translation: What's the present reward?

source_sentence: 所謂布施，心無憍慢，離貪離嫉，信於因緣，信因、信報、信未來世，供養尊長，其心柔軟，正意思惟，捨種種物，攝大富因，攝離慳嫉，信於福田、福田功德、福田種子。
translation: It's called generosity, a mind without pride, free of craving and jealousy, faith in causes and conditions, faith in causes, faith in rewards, and faith in future lives, making offerings to venerable people, a tender heart, correct mental contemplation, renouncing various things, gathering causes of great wealth, gathering freedom from stinginess and jealousy, and faith in the field of merit, the merit of the field of merit, and the seeds of the field of merit.

source_sentence: 王若如是善語熏心，第一淨心功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，久時為王，王領國土久時受樂，國土不亂恒常安隱，不怖不憂，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: If the king thus perfumes his mind with good words and the causes and conditions of the first pure mind's merits, he'll always be comfortable and have constant benefit in the present world, be able to protect his land and protect himself, be praised by good people, become king for a long time, lead his land to lasting happiness, remain unconfused and eternally secure in his land, not be afraid or sad, and be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, and become King Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以能惠施善業因故。
translation: That's because he's able to bestow the causes of good actions.

source_sentence: 「『又，剎利王復有一法是第十五，應勤修習，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, there's another teaching, the fifteenth, that King Śāriputra should diligently cultivate and achieve concomitant with it, for the benefit of the present and future generations.

source_sentence: 第十五者，謂勤愛語。
translation: The fifteenth is to diligently love words.

source_sentence: 愛語王者，一切皆愛，一切皆近。
translation: A king who loves words is someone who loves everything and comes close to everything.

source_sentence: 若與財物，不能如是攝取眾生。
translation: If he were to give possessions, he wouldn't be able to thus gather sentient beings.

source_sentence: 如此愛語，更無能令歡喜清淨如愛語者。
translation: There's nothing such as a loving speech that makes them rejoice and speak purely as a loving speech.

source_sentence: 一切眾生如是因緣，故愛語說。
translation: Because all sentient beings have these kinds of causes, it's called a loving speech.

source_sentence: 先愛心生，然後發語，此因緣故，口說愛語。
translation: A loving mind arises first, then it gives rise to words, and these causes and conditions lead to the utterance of loving words.

source_sentence: 如是王者，能取他城、他國土等，自國、自城他不能得，一切人愛。
translation: Thus, the king can appropriate another city, another land, or so forth, and he can't get his own country or city that's loved by all people.

source_sentence: 王若實語，雜有愛語，設有怨家亦為親友，何況中人本來親者。
translation: If the king speaks truly and speaks with words of love, then even if there's a rival, he's still a friend, so why wouldn't he be among people who are originally close to him?

source_sentence: 王若如是愛語言說，功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，怨成親友，不作中人，一切人愛，一切供養，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，一切人中久時為王，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: If the king thus speaks lovingly and with merit as a cause, he'll always attain well-being and benefit in the present life, become a friend and relative to his enemies, not become a middle man, be loved by all people, make all offerings, protect his land and protect himself, be praised by good people, become a king for a long time among all people, and be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, or become King Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以彼愛語善業因故。
translation: It's because of their loving words and good actions.

source_sentence: 「『又，剎利王復有一法是第十六，應勤修習，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, there's another teaching, the sixteenth, that King Zāri should diligently cultivate, which will bring about concomitant benefits in the present and future generations.

source_sentence: 第十六者，謂修實語。
translation: The sixteenth is cultivating true speech.

source_sentence: 實語者名一切生死解脫之因，不須物買，不可窮盡，乃是大藏，無能劫奪，心海中生，第一叵見，一切善人之所讚歎，一切世間次第流出。
translation: This true speech is called the cause of liberation from all birth-and-death, which needn't be purchased in kind and can't be exhausted; it's a great storehouse that can't be robbed, arises in the ocean of the mind, is the first to be viewed unfathomably, is praised by all good people, and flows out of all the world in sequence.

source_sentence: 此法乃是涅槃城門，於一切時用不可盡，增長功德，能滅諸過，一切人信，能除貧窮。
translation: This teaching is the gateway to the city of nirvāṇa, has inexhaustible uses at all times, increases merit, can end faults, and is believed by all people, and it removes poverty.

source_sentence: 若能實語，雖復醜陋，於餘一切端正人所則為最勝，以實光明而自莊嚴。
translation: If he could truly speak, even though he's ugly, he'd be the most distinguished of all the other upright people, adorning himself with true radiance.

source_sentence: 一切下姓若能實語，則勝一切大姓之人。
translation: If all the lower castes could speak truly, they'd be superior to all the people of larger castes.

source_sentence: 如是實語，莊嚴種姓，一切人信、一切人近，一切人見如見兄弟。
translation: Thus speaking truly, they adorn their family, are believed by all, are approached by all, and are seen by all as brothers.

source_sentence: 隨何處行，於彼彼處為人供養，如父如母、如王不異。
translation: Wherever they go, they'll be supported by people in that place or another place, just like a father, mother, and king.

source_sentence: 雖行曠野險惡之處，猶故受樂。
translation: Even though he travels through a wild and dangerous place, he still enjoys its pleasures.

source_sentence: 隨行何國，為王供養，如供養主。
translation: Wherever he travels, he serves the king as an offering to his lord.

source_sentence: 若村若城、多人住處，一切諸人及大長者皆悉供養。
translation: If there's a village or a city, or many people living there, all of them and great elders will make offerings.

source_sentence: 自餘國土所不行處，流名遍滿，彼處諸人作如是言：「彼處若王、若王大臣實語善行，如高幢幡，名聞六天。」
translation: In other lands, where they don't practice, their reputation spreads, and people there say, "Suppose there's a king or a minister of the king who really speaks and conducts himself well, like a tall banner or pennant, and is known as one of the six gods."

source_sentence: 彼善男子，天常供養，隨後而行，不見惡夢。
translation: That good man is always offered offerings by the gods, and he travels afterward without seeing bad dreams.

source_sentence: 第一勝天，供養如天。
translation: He's the most excellent god, making offerings like a god.

source_sentence: 若更貧窮，以實語故，後還大富。
translation: If he were even poor, he'd return to great wealth later because of true words.

source_sentence: 一切憶念皆具足得。
translation: All [these] recollections are fully attained.

source_sentence: 念念漸老，諸根不衰。
translation: He gradually ages with each passing thought, but his faculties don't fade.

source_sentence: 得好神通、大力身體，作長命業，成就相應。
translation: They attain excellent superknowledge and a powerful body, and they create long-lived karma that's compatible with their achievements.

source_sentence: 一切諍對，以其為量，以其為證。
translation: All confrontations are measured by them, and they are the realization of those confrontations.

source_sentence: 若犯王法被收縛者，以物寄之，唯此一人最為可信。
translation: If someone who violates the king's laws and is bound by them is sent something, this is the only person who's most trustworthy.

source_sentence: 如是富者以物寄之，以實語故，心意不動。
translation: Thus, a wealthy person sends them something, and because of their true words, their mind isn't disturbed.

source_sentence: 怨親之人不能令動，唯以實相而自娛樂，生歡喜心。
translation: He can't cause those who dislike him to be moved, but he entertains himself with his true features and becomes joyous.

source_sentence: 以實語食，而自充飽。
translation: He feeds himself with real words and fills himself up.

source_sentence: 實語之愛數數思惟，或瞋、或喜不動其心。
translation: He repeatedly reflects on the love of real words, and his mind isn't moved by anger or joy.

source_sentence: 此王則是第一大仙，常作世間及出世間二種利益，不越所作，實畫之文，常以實水澡浴清淨，常著鮮白無縷寶衣。
translation: This king is the first great sage who always produces both worldly and transmundane benefits, doesn't transgress what he does, paints real pictures, always bathes himself in real water to purify himself, and always wears a pure, white, and threadless jeweled robe.

source_sentence: 實名之香，十方遍嗅。
translation: The fragrance of a real name is pervasive in ten directions.

source_sentence: 一切世間未相見者，皆成知友，何況見者，善名流布過須彌峯。
translation: All those who have never seen each other in the world become close friends, not to mention those who see them, and their good reputation spreads beyond Mount Sumeru.

source_sentence: 雖是年少，老人見之，供養如父。
translation: Even though they're young, old people see them and offer support like their father.

source_sentence: 以實老故，亦復能作長命之業，乃至造作無上菩提大智之業，何況能造夜摩天王世間之業。
translation: Because he's really old, he's still able to create actions that will lead to long life and even create the actions of great wisdom that lead to unsurpassed bodhi, so why wouldn't he be able to create the worldly actions of King Yama?

source_sentence: 王若如是修如實語，功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: If the king thus cultivates the merits and causes of true speech, he'll always attain well-being and benefit in the present world, protect his land and protect himself, be praised by good people, and be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, and he'll be the king of Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以修實語善業因故。
translation: That's because it's the cause of cultivating good actions that are based on true speech.

source_sentence: 「『又，剎利王復有一法是第十七，應勤修習，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, there's another teaching, the seventeenth, that King Śāriputra should diligently cultivate and achieve commensurate with it for the benefit of the present and future generations.

source_sentence: 第十七者，謂於臣眾若無因緣，不舉不下。
translation: The seventeenth is that if there are no causes or conditions for a group of ministers, they won't be reprimanded.

source_sentence: 是王重意，彼王不知他戒形相及不知意，則不生信。
translation: This is the king's important intention, and if he doesn't know the appearance of other precepts and doesn't know their intention, then faith won't arise.

source_sentence: 為王之法：細意思惟，然後乃作。
translation: The rule for kings is to carefully contemplate it before doing it.

source_sentence: 王於臣眾若不於先深細思惟，或下、或舉，彼則非王。
translation: If a king doesn't first deeply consider his subjects, or if he sometimes puts them down or raises them up, then he's not a king.

source_sentence: 若為王者，則不久滅，唯可單有王名而已。
translation: If he were a king, it wouldn't be long before he ceased to exist, but he could simply be called a king.

source_sentence: 不思惟作，心意少動，意輕不住，若說舊法，眾則不信，言王妄語，是故於王不生愛心，或以餘人換其王位。
translation: When they don't contemplate their actions, their minds are little moved, and their intentions are not held lightly.

source_sentence: 是故王者知此過已，不作妄語。
translation: Therefore, once the king knows this mistake, he doesn't speak falsely.

source_sentence: 如是妄語，現在、未來不能利益，是故現在無量種過。
translation: Such false speech won't benefit the present or future, and therefore there are measureless faults in the present.

source_sentence: 知此過已，不妄語說。
translation: After knowing this error, he doesn't speak falsely.

source_sentence: 餘人若爾，亦不相應，況復王者，如是如是失於王法，如是如是亦失世間。
translation: If that's the case for other people, they won't agree, so much the less the king, who would lose the king's teaching and the world as well.

source_sentence: 若王有福，勝世間人，一切皆勝。
translation: If the king is blessed, he's superior to worldly people, and all of them are superior.

source_sentence: 王常實語則護世間，護彼樂故，王法不妨。
translation: When the king always speaks truly, he protects the world, and because he protects their happiness, the king's Dharma can't be helped.

source_sentence: 一切善法，實為根本。
translation: All good qualities are really fundamental.

source_sentence: 若不實說，則於臣眾無有因緣或舉、或下。
translation: If he doesn't speak truly, then there's no cause for his ministers to be lifted up or down.

source_sentence: 若常實語，則於仕人若無因緣不舉、不下。
translation: If he always spoke truly, then there wouldn't be a reason for his servants not to be lifted up or down.

source_sentence: 王若如是，則於王位不動不失，一切臣眾知王如是，則不捨離，向他國土；深生敬重，如父如母，一切時樂，生歡喜心。
translation: If the king thus does, his position won't be vacillated or lost, and when all his subjects know that the king thus does, they won't abandon him and go to another land; they will deeply respect him as father and mother, and they'll be delighted and rejoice at all times.

source_sentence: 彼王則有堅意、住意，有不動意、有一廂意，與臣眾樂。
translation: The king then has a resolute mind, an abiding mind, an unmoving mind, and a single-minded mind, and he's happy with his subjects.

source_sentence: 王若如是不無因緣或舉、或下，功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: If the king thus doesn't lack causes or conditions that sometimes lift or lower him, and merit causes and conditions, he'll always attain well-being and constant benefit in the present world, protect his land and protect himself, be praised by good people, and be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, and he'll be the king of Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以無因緣不舉、不下善業因故。
translation: That's because there are no causes or conditions that aren't lifted or that don't lay down the causes of good actions.

source_sentence: 「『又，剎利王復有一法是第十八，應勤修習，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, there's another teaching, the eighteenth, that King Zali should diligently cultivate and achieve commensurate with it for the benefit of the present and future generations.

source_sentence: 第十八者，謂能識知人之善惡。
translation: The eighteenth is the ability to know the good and bad qualities of people.

source_sentence: 此大智慧數數修故，若能知者，則為第一最勝大王。
translation: Because this great wisdom has been cultivated repeatedly, if he could know it, then he would be the first and most distinguished great king.

source_sentence: 王知彼人是智、非智，若如是知，則是世間一切地器，任為王者，一切他王不能破壞。
translation: If the king knows whether that person is wise or not wise, and if he thus knows, then he's a vessel for all the world's lands and can be a king, and all the other kings can't destroy him.

source_sentence: 若勤所作，如所應處，安置使令，彼如是業皆得成就，不失財物。
translation: If he diligently works and places them as they should be, he'll be able to accomplish such actions without losing his possessions.

source_sentence: 於所作法，次第增長。
translation: These things that they do will increase in sequence.

source_sentence: 王見人中若非法行，王則不攝。
translation: If the king sees that there are people who aren't doing what's right, the king won't take them in.

source_sentence: 貪食之人、不知恩人，王則不攝。
translation: The king won't take in a person who craves food and doesn't know about kindness.

source_sentence: 多人怨人、邪見之人、無憐愍人、妄語之人、他王怨人、惡律儀人、不知時人、難調伏人、常惡業人、著境界人、曲因說人、其體本性不知足人、恒常不作利益行人、常於他所先作惡人、慢心之人、常樂怨人、踴躍之人、語動之人、意動之人如是等人，王則不攝。
translation: The king doesn't include people who are resentful of many people, people with wrong views, people without compassion, people who speak falsely, people resented by other kings, people with bad manners, people who don't know the time, people who are difficult to subdue, people who are always engaged in bad behavior, people who are attached to the objective world, people who twist causation, people who don't know the adequacy of their true nature, people who constantly fail to act for the benefit of others, people who always do evil before others, people who are conceited, people who are always delighted with resentment, people who are excited, people whose speech moves, people whose thoughts move, and so on.

source_sentence: 攝何等人？
translation: What kind of person is he to include?

source_sentence: 所謂隨法修行之人、不諂曲人、不我慢人、實語之人、聰明智人、柔軟心人、不惱他人、不誑他人、於三寶所能供養人、得信之人、知足之人、調伏之人、不懈怠人、常作業人、少食之人、一切愛人、有慈心人、有悲心人、精進之人、正見之人、智慧之人、依法律人、生來清淨身口意人、信因緣人、知業報人、不飲酒人、不多睡人、近善友人、樂惠施人、有戒之人、有智之人如是等人，王則應攝。
translation: Such people as those who practice according to the teaching, don't flatter others, aren't conceited about themselves, are truthful speakers, are intelligent and wise, are gentle-hearted, don't vex others, don't deceive others, make offerings to the Three Treasures, attain faith, are contented, are disciplined, aren't lazy, are always at work, eat little, love people, are compassionate, are diligent, have right views, are wise, rely on the law, are born with pure body, speech, and mind, believe in causes and conditions, know the results of their actions, don't drink alcohol, don't get much sleep, are close to good friends, are happy to give, are disciplined, and have wisdom are such people that the king should include.

source_sentence: 如是等人，王於其中知輕知重，堪為何業，則令營作。
translation: Such a person knows the least of these and knows the most serious, and the king makes them work when they're capable of doing so.

source_sentence: 彼王如是，更無餘王能為破壞，無量財寶富樂具足，隨順法行。
translation: Thus, there's no other king who can do damage, who has measureless possessions and riches, and who conducts himself according to the Dharma.

source_sentence: 隨法行故，則能布施，能為福德，供養三寶。
translation: Because he practices according to the Dharma, he's able to give alms, which generates merit and makes offerings to the Three Treasures.

source_sentence: 王若如是知人好惡，功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: If the king thus knows the good and bad qualities of people and the causes and conditions of their merits, he'll always attain well-being and constant benefit in the present world, protect his land and protect himself, be praised by good people, and be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, becoming King Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以識別人善業因故。
translation: That's because it identifies the causes of a person's good actions.

source_sentence: 「『又，剎利王復有一法是第十九，應勤修習，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, there's another teaching, the nineteenth, that King Zāri should diligently cultivate, which will bring benefits in the present and future generations when it's accomplished.

source_sentence: 第十九者，謂定一時數見眾人。
translation: The nineteenth is when he fixes one time to see many people repeatedly.

source_sentence: 若剎利王常定一時數見眾人，如是王者久時為王，一切國人皆不嫌恨，能知一切人之善惡，能令國人一切行法，強不陵弱，一切國人隨時見王，財物具足。
translation: If a king of the bhadra always fixes one time to see many people, then when he's king for a long time, none of his countrymen will resent him, he'll be able to know the good and bad qualities of all people, cause his countrymen to conduct themselves in ways that are strong and not weak, and all of his countrymen will see the king at all times and have plenty of possessions.

source_sentence: 以此方便，增長熾盛財法富故，不屬他王，以安隱故，隨順法行，供養沙門、婆羅門等，從其聞法。
translation: Because of this skillful means, they grow wealthy and rich in property and principles, don't belong to other kings, and because of their comfort, they follow the practice of the Dharma and make offerings to ascetics, priests, and others who hear the Dharma from them.

source_sentence: 既聞法已，法行轉勝，以定一時數見人故，修法之行，轉勝增上。
translation: After hearing the Dharma, their Dharma practice becomes superior, and because they're certain to see people on a regular basis, their practice of cultivating the Dharma becomes superior and increased.

source_sentence: 如是如是隨法行故，如是如是富樂增長。
translation: As a result of thus-and-so following the practice of the Dharma, their prosperity and happiness will thus-and-so increase.

source_sentence: 大富樂故，能大布施，廣作福業，精勤持戒。
translation: Because of their great prosperity and happiness, they're able to give generously, work extensively to improve their fortune, and diligently observe precepts.

source_sentence: 王若難見，彼王則無如是功德，是故王者應定一時常數見人。
translation: If it were difficult for the king to see them, the king wouldn't have such virtue; therefore, the king should set a time when he'll always see people.

source_sentence: 王者若能常定一時數見人者，則能行法，是行法人有大福德。
translation: If the king can always fix a time to see people often, then he'll be able to practice the Dharma, and this practitioner will have great merit.

source_sentence: 王若如是常定一時數見眾人，功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: If the king thus constantly fixes his attention on seeing people for a certain number of hours, the merits of those causes and conditions will always make him comfortable and beneficial in the present life, protect his land and protect himself, be praised by good people, and be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, making him King Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以定一時數見眾人善業因故。
translation: That's because he's determined to see the causes of many people's good actions at one time.

source_sentence: 「『又，剎利王復有一法是第二十，應勤修習，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, there's another teaching, the twentieth, that King Zali should diligently cultivate, which will be associated with its accomplishment and will benefit both the present and future generations.

source_sentence: 第二十者，謂少睡眠。
translation: The twentieth is a little sleep.

source_sentence: 少睡眠故，心善思惟，意不錯謬，不愚不鈍，怨不得便，恒常一意。
translation: Because there's little sleep, their mind well contemplates, their intentions aren't mistaken, they aren't foolish or dull, and they're always focused on what's disliked.

source_sentence: 所作決定，決定作故，善思惟作。
translation: What's done is determined, and it's done because it's determined to be done, and it's done because it's well-considered.

source_sentence: 王若如是善思惟作，隨何等法，皆速成就，不經久時。
translation: If the king thus well contemplates its action, whatever it is, it's accomplished quickly and without a long period of time.

source_sentence: 彼王晨朝則不放逸，不放逸故，壽命則長。
translation: The king doesn't become careless in the morning, and because he doesn't become careless, his life is long.

source_sentence: 善思惟故，一切國人心則慕樂，不生厭惡。
translation: Because he well contemplates it, the people of all the countries will adore it and not become disillusioned with it.

source_sentence: 國內人民、一切軍眾、一切僮僕、左右百官、諸大臣等，皆悉熾盛。
translation: The people of the kingdom, all his armies, all his servants, his right and left officers, and his ministers all flourish.

source_sentence: 財物豐饒，多臣民故，則多財物；多財物故，有大威德；有威德故，則能布施修行福業，能善持戒。
translation: Their goods are abundant, and because there are many subjects, there's plenty of goods; because there are plenty of goods, there's great authority; and because there's authority, they're able to cultivate meritorious behavior by generosity and to observe precepts well.

source_sentence: 王若如是少於睡眠功德力故，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: Because of the power of the virtues of little sleep, the king will always be comfortable and productive in the present life, be able to protect his land and protect himself, be praised by good people, and be born on a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, becoming King Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以少睡眠善業因故。
translation: That's because of the good actions of a little sleep.

source_sentence: 「『又，剎利王復有一法是二十一，應勤修習，成就相應，現在、未來二世利益。
translation: "'Furthermore, there's another teaching, King Zali, that's twenty-one, which should be diligently cultivated and achieved to bring benefits in the present and two future lives.

source_sentence: 二十一者，謂一切時常不懈怠。
translation: The twenty-one refers to being constantly noncontentious at all times.

source_sentence: 不懈怠王，堅固精進，如法修業，隨何所作，一切皆能究竟成就。
translation: The king who isn't lazy is resolute and energetic, cultivating his actions according to the Dharma and accomplishing whatever he does.

source_sentence: 隨心制御，皆悉屬己，他不能壞、他不能奪。
translation: Whatever he controls with his mind, it's all his own, and it can't be destroyed by others or taken away by others.

source_sentence: 一切國人愛王心意，皆生敬重。
translation: All the people of his kingdom love the king's mind and hold it in high esteem.

source_sentence: 其王國土一切皆善，一切具足。
translation: All of their kingdoms and lands are good and fully supplied with everything.

source_sentence: 若城若村、多人住處，遍滿國內，間不空曠。
translation: There are cities, villages, and many dwelling places that fill the kingdom and aren't empty at times.

source_sentence: 不懈怠王，堅固精進，有大勢力，如是如是隨何所作，彼彼所作一切成就。
translation: The king isn't lazy, is resolute and energetic, has great power, and does whatever he wants to do, and everything he does is accomplished by that person.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 不懈怠故。
translation: He's not lazy, so he doesn't neglect.

source_sentence: 法時處等，方便具足。
translation: Dharma, time, place, and so forth, are fully equipped with skillful means.

source_sentence: 不懈怠王，於世間業、出世間業皆能成就，乃至能成涅槃之業，何況餘業。
translation: The king who isn't lazy can achieve both worldly and transmundane actions, even actions that lead to nirvāṇa, so why wouldn't he achieve other actions?

source_sentence: 若勤精進而不懈怠，時處方便，所作具足，彼王則勝一切餘人，種種具足。
translation: If he diligently undertakes effort without laziness, and his actions are complete in terms of both time and place, that king is superior to all others and is complete in every way.

source_sentence: 彼王如是世間所作，皆悉成就，如是共智，而復能作。
translation: The king has accomplished all such worldly tasks, and he's capable of doing them even with this shared knowledge.

source_sentence: 出世間業皆悉成就，出世間者，謂施、戒、智。
translation: He's accomplished all the activities of the transmundane world, which are generosity, morality, and wisdom.

source_sentence: 王若如是常不懈怠，功德因緣，於現在世常得安樂，常有利益，能護國土、能護自身，善人所讚，施、戒、智等猶如香氣，身壞命終生於善道，天世界中為夜摩王。
translation: If the king thus remains uncontaminated and doesn't neglect the causes and conditions of his virtues, he'll always attain well-being and constant benefit in the present world, protect his land and protect himself, be praised by good people, and be like an odor of generosity, morality, and wisdom, which will lead to birth in a good path when his body breaks up and his life ends, and he'll be the king of Yama in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 以不懈怠善業因故。
translation: That's because he doesn't neglect the causes of good actions.

source_sentence: 正法念處經卷第五十四
translation: Sutra of the Mindfulness of the True Dharma, Volume 54
